name: Greeley Chorale Practice Materials
subtitle: In Development
description: Greeley Chorale Practice Materials is a MERNG-stack web application to house and easily navigate rehearsal materials for upcoming events and for facilitating communication from Chorale administration to the singers.
tech: Technologies used: MongoDB, Mongoose, Express, Apollo/GraphQL, Node.js, React.js, React Hooks, React Bootstrap, Flexbox, JSX, JWT, CSS3, ES6

name: Bristlecone Conference Management System
subtitle: In Development
description: Bristlecone Conference Management System is an extensive, in-development build-out adapted from the Cool Cats Conference Planner code base. Like Cool Cats, it is a MERN-stack application that allows users to share information about and accept session and presenter proposals for their own conferences and conventions; and to submit session proposals to, register to attend or exhibit at, and view others' conferences and conventions.
tech: Technologies used: MongoDB, Mongoose, Express, Node.js, GraphQL, React.js, Auth0.com, Bootstrap, React Bootstrap, TypeScript, CSS3, ES6, Moment, thenBy.js, multer

name: Cool Cats Conference Planner
description: Cool Cats Conference Planner was also built through the collaborative efforts of six students, including me. It is a MERN-stack application that allows users to share information about their own conferences and conventions as well as view and register for others' conferences and conventions.
tech: Technologies used: MongoDB, Mongoose, Express, Node.js, React.js, Auth0.com, Bootstrap, React Bootstrap, JSX, CSS3, ES6

name: Couch Surfers Travel Blog
description: Couch Surfers Travel Blog was likewise built through the collaborative efforts of six students, including me. It uses jQuery, Express.js, Express Handlebars, Sequelize, and Passport to create a semi-public (all posts visible, but only to those who are signed in) miniblog (500 characters or less) site for travelers to share with each other their travel tips, tricks, and experiences. It includes a Resources page for those looking for a place to start their adventures.
tech: Technologies used: HTML5, CSS3, Bootstrap, Node.js, Express, Express Handlebars, jQuery, MySQL, Sequelize, Passport, Particles.js, Bootstrap

name: Taco Party
description: Taco Party was built through the collaborative efforts of six students, including me. It uses the Materialize framework for layout and mobile-responsiveness, JavaScript/jQuery, and two third-party APIs to provide a resource for users to plan their taco party. Users can generate random taco- or salsa-based recipes, visit the 'Taco' and 'Salsa' pages to view all available recipes, and visit the 'Beverages' pages to browse recipes for adult mixed drinks.
tech: Technologies used: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, 3rd-party APIs, Materialize

name: Weather Dashboard
description: The Weather Dashboard uses jQuery and the OpenWeather API to provide weather information. The user types the city about which they're wanting weather information into the 'search' function, and the dashboard then provides current weather conditions and a five-day forecast for that city. While subtitlesequent searches will replace the five-day forecast, the current conditions will still be visible at the bottom of the page, and all searched cities appear in the 'history' section for ease of repeating searches.
tech: Technologies used: HTML5, CSS3, Bootstrap, local storage, jQuery, Day.js, OpenWeather API

name: Team Profile Generator
description: The Team Profile Generator is a CLI-based application that takes the user through a series of prompts to generate an html document containing names, roles, emails, and ids of all members of a software-development team.

name: Employee Management System
description: This is a CLI employee management system application using Inquirer.js and MySQL. This system allows the user to add employees, departments, and roles; view employees (all, by department, and by role), departments, and roles; update employee roles; and delete employees.
tech: Technologies used: Node.js, Inquirer, Express, MySQL, console.table npm package

name: Employee Directory
description: This application uses React to generate and manipulate a table of employee information. The user can click on any column header to sort the table by that column, or type into the input box to search for an employee by last name. Reloading the page following a name search will reset the table to show all employees.

name: Google Books Search
description: This is a MERN-stack application that incorporates JWT authentication and the Google Books API. The user can search for a book by title. If they sign up and log in, they can save searched books to a list of favorites, or delete books from their list of favorites. Any user, logged in or not, can click a like to get additional information at the Google Books site.
tech: Technologies used: MongoDB, Express.js, React.js, Node.js, JWT

name: Happy Holidays 2020
description: This is a simple little React-based 'Happy Holidays' animation using the Twinkling Night Sky animation by Sharna Hossain, react-simple-animate, react-bootstrap, react-confetti, and react-snowfall.
tech: Technologies used: Node.js, React.js, react-simple-animate, React Bootstrap, Flexbox, react-confetti, react-snowfall
